void util_queue_create (util_queue_t *queue)

Function Documentation

void util_queue_create ( util_queue_t *  queue  ) 

The util_queue_create routine creates a queue used by the application to queue several objects such like messages.

NOTE: All objects which have to be queued require a simple void pointer (void*). This pointer is the first element of the object.

Parameters:
queue Specifies the queue resource.
Returns:
A handle to the created queue indicates success. NULL indicates failure.
See also:
util_queue_destroy
